instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165  Bouncing Bitch  (no sign of H2O)
threads.message:
The Bounce.    Pulls .3A and shuts down.   From no power it will bounce twice in about 4 seconds.    The SMC appears perfect.   The SMC gives it a second try.   after that it settles at 0.030A and just sits there.
the 5V rail and 3V rails come up but the 3V3 rail stays up.

All rails enter S0.  All sys PWR Good is present about .2 seconds.
All rails have normal resistance to ground.

No signs of water.   Power washed under BGA packages as a last effort.
Bios is loading.  CPU is not booting and accessing RAM.   Only U3900 lights up for a brief second on thermal.  Which is totally normal for this.
Thermal shows no shorts.  "none I can see".

What should I check next?  How do you trouble shoot bounces like this?

threads.title: 820-00165  Bouncing Bitch  (no sign of H2O)
threads.message:
Likely CPU issue.
Did you try SMC bypass mode?

Also try the board removing U8130.

threads.title: 820-00165  Bouncing Bitch  (no sign of H2O)
threads.message:
Removed U8130  no help
PM_SYSRST_L is present but only briefly.

threads.title: 820-00165  Bouncing Bitch  (no sign of H2O)
threads.message:
Possibly internal problem on PCH/CPU.
Try to heat untill 180-200 degrees for 15-20s.

threads.title: 820-00165  Bouncing Bitch  (no sign of H2O)
threads.message: no luck.   I often use that heating trick on intermittent boards to see if the PCH has issues.

threads.title: 820-00165  Bouncing Bitch  (no sign of H2O)
threads.message: look u5110 or try change it
